newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola futures end down on fund selling.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola futures end down on fund selling.

text.p: WCE canola ended down on fund selling, traders said.

"Funds were big sellers of July. There were large commission house sell stops and there was excellent commercial buying at the close," a trader said. July WCE futures crush margin rose to -4.21 Wednesday from -7.05 Tuesday. About 500 July-Nov spread at $31.50, Sep-Nov $3, 178 Aug-Nov $32.50.
Japan bought 3,000-4,000 tonnes overnight, sources said.
May canola fell $5.70 to $416.30, July down $7.10 to $417.50, November down $3.40 at $385. July flax down $0.70 to $332.30, November down $0.70 at $318.60 as UGG bought, traders said.
July feed wheat lost $0.60 to $159.30, October down $0.80 to $161.70 on commercial liquidation. Oct-Dec spread $1.
July western barley up $0.10 to $136, October up $0.30 to $137.40 on commission buying, commercials sold. July-Oct $1.
PCTS bought October feed peas contracts down US$1 to US$191.50 from LFG, a trader said. October oats traded unchanged at US$119.
(All prices in Canadian dollars/tonne except oats, peas).
